page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: Agriculture in this area is predominantly arable, with the main crops being{wheat, barley, oilseed {rape and sugar beet.}Other crops may be introduced to lengthen the rotation. These are usually peas for freezing or potatoes. There are also relatively small areas of permanent grassland, both improved and unimproved, used for grazing animals. The area of pasture land has diminished in recent years, as farmers specialise in crop growing, following changes in EEC policy over beef and milk production. Farms are usually about 300 acres, but farmers may let part of their own land, or rent other fields, for specific purposes. Some farms are worked as parts of larger units of three or more farms combined.
